required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Optimized Behavioural Intervention Using The Multi-Phase Optimization Strategy (MOST).
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Optimized Behavioural Intervention Using The Multi-Phase Optimization Strategy (MOST) on Oral Hygiene Habits of Pre-school Children in Egypt.

brief_summary.textblock: In the current study, MOST approach is proposed, to engineer an oral health behavior modification intervention, to increase the engagement of mothers in brushing their pre-school children's teeth.

detailed_description.textblock: The first phase of this study will be the preparation phase. This will comprise the development of a conceptual framework and conducting a feasibility pilot study consisting of three intervention components: Motivational interviewing (MI), Oral health promotion messages (OHPm), and Storytelling (ST). The second phase of the study is the optimization phase which constitutes a factorial trial of the three selected intervention components (MI, OHPm and ST). Each component will be set at two levels: yes (the intervention is applied) vs no (the intervention is not applied).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A factorial trial following the Multiphase optimization Strategy (MOST)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the plaque index scores of participating children
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the Plaque index (PII) of Silness and Loe

primary_outcome.measure: Change in children's frequency of toothbrushing and use of fluoridated toothpaste
primary_outcome.description: Using the World Health Organization (WHO) questionnaire

arm_group.description: Participants will receive the constant component only.
Participants will receive the constant component and storytelling videos .
Participants will receive the constant component and oral health promotion messages.
Participants will receive the constant component and a motivational interview session.
Participants will receive the constant component, oral health promotion messages and storytelling videos.
Participants will receive the constant component, oral health promotion messages, storytelling videos, and a motivational interview session.
Participants will receive the constant component, oral health promotion messages and a motivational interview session.
Participants will receive the constant component, storytelling videos, and a motivational interview session.

intervention.description: The study will use a factorial design to evaluate the efficacy of three distinct intervention components: Motivational interviewing, storytelling videos and oral health promotion messages, in enhancing mothers' brushing of their preschool children's teeth using fluoridated toothpaste.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria for mother's of children enrolled in study:
- Has children between 2 and <5 years of age
- Has children with high plaque index scores (PlIâ‰¥2 or visible plaque accumulation on maxillary anterior teeth).
- Literate and owns a mobile phone with already set-up or possibility to set-up Whats-App messenger application.
- Willing to participate in the study and receive periodic OHPm and ST videos.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mothers of children who are not willing to cooperate and show a definite negative behavior (Rating 1 Frankel's classification).
- Mothers of children who are physically disabled or medically compromised.
- Mothers of children in need of emergency dental treatments.

clinical_study.keyword: MOST, behavioural intervention, early childhood caries
